result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter C Mathews

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter C Mathews appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Peter C Mathews.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations, parties are requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Peter C Mathews in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Peter C Mathews.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for additional hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Peter C Mathews in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Peter C Mathews.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pretrial conference. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with OG (11/13/1982); AB (09/15/1980); CR (11/09/1994).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Peter C Mathews in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Peter C Mathews in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Peter C Mathews appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
